page.title: 17MANOR FARM_DAIRY COWS.
page.content: The 92 cows on the farm at present each produce about 40 litres of milk each day.Under the Common Market quota scheme,Mr.Richards is only allowed to produce 500,000 litres per year.Grass apart,they are fed on silage (70lbs a day), maize and BOCM concentrate eaten at milking time. The cows are milked twice a day,ten at a time in the herringbone parlour.A cow's milking life is about 10 years. They are then sold for slaughter for Â£20. Manor Farm has no bull of its own. The heifers are either artificially inseminated or are served by a bull hired for 9 weeks at a cost of Â£10 per week. Milk is collected by tanker and delivered to a local dairy.
